alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following county, Tippecanoe. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 113 PM EST, emergency management reported an ice jam near the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Flooding is occurring or likely to develop in the Barton Beach and Eisenhower bridge area along Wildcat Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
